description:
At the December 2017 Python Frederick meetup, Christine Lee provided an excellent overview of the Python data science ecosystem. There's a lot of info so the topics are listed below with their times.

Anaconda - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=236
NumPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=726
SymPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=1204
SciPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=1827
scikit-learn - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=2432
pandas - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=3385
matplotlib - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=3953
Bokey and Plotly - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=4458
Jupyter Notebooks - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=5520

https://www.pythonfrederick.org/

Talk material can be found at https://github.com/python-frederick/talks/tree/master/2017-12-data-science.
title: Data science in Python (Python Frederick)
